required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: BCMA and CD19 Targeted Fast Dual CAR-T for BCMA+ Refractory/Relapsed Multiple Myeloma
clinical_study.official_title: Exploratory Study to Evaluate Efficacy and Safety of GC012F Injection in BCMA+ Refractory/Relapsed Multiple Myeloma

brief_summary.textblock: This is a single arm, open-label, multi-center prospective study to determine the safety and efficacy of GC012F CAR-T cells in patients diagnosed with BCMA+ refractory/relapsed multiple myeloma (r/r MM).

detailed_description.textblock: The main aim of the study is to determine the safety and efficacy of GC012F in r/r MM. GC012F is an autologous dual chimeric antigen receptor T-cell (CAR-T) therapy that targets B-cell maturation antigen (BCMA) and CD19. This study comprises of a Screening Phase (less than or equal to [<=] 28 days prior to apheresis) followed by Apheresis (will occur upon enrollment); Treatment Phase including a conditioning regimen followed by infusion of GC012F and post-infusion assessments from Day 1 to Day 84; and a Post-treatment Phase (Day 85 and up to end of the study). Efficacy will be explored to assessed and safety will be closely monitored during the study.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence and severity of adverse events after GC012F infusion
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 24 weeks after GC012F infusion

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of MRD negative patients after GC012F treatment
ORR (PR, VGPR, CR and sCR) of patients receive GC012F treatment
Progression free survival after GC012F treatment
Copies and cell counts of CAR in blood and bone marrow (if available) after GC012F treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Days 4, 7, 10, 14 and weeks 4, 8, 12, 18, 24 after GC012F infusion
secondary_outcome.description: Bone marrows will be collected in weeks 4, 8, 12, 18, 24 after GC012F infusion.

secondary_outcome.measure: Cytokines in serum after GC012F treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Days 4, 7, 10, 14 and weeks 4, 8, 12, 18, 24 after GC012F infusion

secondary_outcome.measure: Subset of lymphocytes and ADA in blood after GC012F treatment
Replication competent lentivirus (RCL) in blood after GC012F treatment
Duration of response after GC012F treatment

arm_group.description: BCMA+ R/R multiple myeloma patients be treated with a single dose of GC012F cells. Total dose of (1-5)*10E5/kg cells will be administered at Day 0.

intervention.description: GC012F injection is a autologous dual CAR-T targeted BCMA and CD19. A single infusion of CART cells will be administered intravenously.
